intro: Synchoriste, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and chrysanthemums. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, often blooming in summer. It has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening. Synchoriste is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
